intro: Pimpinella sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis' cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its seeds are small and have a distinctive, ridged appearance. Pimpinella sintenisii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
